title: Requires the state comptroller to offer the top three proposals received by an administrative service agency or financial organization to each ambulance service part
summary: Requires the state comptroller to offer the top three proposals received by an administrative service agency or financial organization to each ambulance service participating in a service award program.

       AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to requiring  the
         state  comptroller  to  offer  the  top three proposals received by an
         administrative service agency or financial organization to each  ambu-
         lance service participating in a service award program

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 219-h  of  the  general  municipal
    2  law,  as  amended by chapter 514 of the laws of 1998, is amended to read
    3  as follows:
    4    1. Service award programs shall be centrally administered by the state
    5  comptroller, or the comptroller may  enter  into  one  or  more  of  the
    6  following contracts:
    7    (a)    a  contract  with an administrative service agency or financial
    8  organization to serve as program administrator and to perform all or any
    9  portion of the functions  required  to  establish  and  administer  such
   10  programs  including, but not limited to, preparation of a plan document,
   11  record keeping, reporting, payment of service awards, and having custody
   12  of program moneys and assets; or
   13    (b) contracts with one  or  more  financial  organizations  to  invest
   14  program moneys.
   15    If  the  comptroller  contracts for the performance of any function as
   16  provided in this subdivision, the comptroller shall OFFER THE TOP  THREE
   17  PROPOSALS RECEIVED FROM THE ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICE AGENCIES OR FINANCIAL
   18  ORGANIZATIONS  TO  THE  AMBULANCE SERVICE.   THE AMBULANCE SERVICE SHALL
   19  SELECT AN ADMINISTRATOR AND INFORM THE COMPTROLLER.
   20    THE COMPTROLLER SHALL be liable only for the exercise of due  care  in
